diff_hunk:
@@ -375,7 +375,9 @@ def test_backward(self):
         y = a * b
 
         trace = torch._C._tracer_enter((x, y), 2)
-        z = y * 2 * x
+        # NB: Parenthesization here seems important, otherwise the
+        # evaluation order is nondeterministic
+        z = (y * 2) * x
body: OK, never mind, I reread the manual rules on evaluation order https://docs.python.org/3/reference/expressions.html#evaluation-order and I am not sure how the test failure I cited here can ever occur... Python bug, maybe?
